intro: Nunnezharia pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered nunnezharia, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale pink, typically during the cooler months. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy, glandular leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Nunnezharia pauciflora is considered a species of conservation concern.
